content: quote: COMMENT: Of course, we weren't enduring a monumental global recession in August 2006, and it's a "far cry" from disagreeing with a political agenda three years ago as opposed to Limbaugh's clarion call now in the midst of an extraordinary financial crisis affecting every American horrendously to assert that he hopes that Obama fails. You're an intelligent guy. You know where the term "decimate" came from. If Caesar's solution to the problem was to decimate your legion, wouldn't you hope that he would fail? And that another solution be presented? Or even just considered? It's that simple. What is scary is you cult of personality followers who all of sudden can't divorce the ideas of "Obama" and "America" (as envisioned by it's chief architects.) Everyone BUT Obama and Rahm (Never let a good crisis go to waste) Emmanuel wants the economy to recover as quickly as possible with our "America" intact as it was intended. Obama is hoping to capitalize on the failed economy to rush through changes in the very fabric of our nation. The longer the economy stays depressed the easier it will be for him. So yes. I too want Obama to fail with this scheme, because I see his failure as America's success. How simple minded a bleat from the "four legs good, two legs bad" corner of the barn: "He wants Obama to fail!"

content: I really haven't heard Rush Limbaugh in 20 years, still, if the very sound of his name sends the whiny, kool-ade drooling, self-absorbed followers of Nancy, Harry, Heidi and Seal and Bono into a tizzy, I suppose he's useful as a distraction, to avert their attentions away from us in the real world. If the left feels that their leader can be toppled by a bloviator, then they don't have much faith in the Messiah they themselves ordained.

content: quote: We're in genuinely dire circumstances, and Limbaugh's appeals for failure are divisive and not well-received; again, it's all about him, not about average Americans. In 1933, in an economically destroyed European country, Limbaugh's "Call for failure" would have been viewed by today's historians as the voice of reason against encroaching totaltarianism. You claim repeatedly to be a republican. You claim repeatedly not be a follower of any one ideology, yet the arguments you consistently present indicate otherwise, along with a consistent animosity toward the previous administration. Whatever your ID card says sir, You're quacking like a duck and have been for some time.
